intro: Atriplex hastata var. patula, commonly known as saltbush or shadscale, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of the western United States. It is characterized by its gray-green, succulent leaves that help reduce water loss in harsh environments. The plant produces small, greenish flowers in clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. Its salt-tolerant nature allows it to thrive in saline soils, making it an important component of desert ecosystems. The leaves and stems are often used in traditional Native American medicine for their purported health benefits.
